clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Remote Ischemic Preconditioning on Electrophysiological and Biomolecular Parameters in Non-valvular Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation: RIPPAF Study
clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Remote Ischemic Preconditioning on Electrophysiological and Biomolecular Parameters in Non-valvular Paroxysmal Atrial Fibrillation: RIPPAF Study

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to examine the effect of RIPC on physiological parameters in non-valvular paroxysmal atrial fibrillation. Furthermore the study will provide a unique bio-date base for further analysis of molecular and genetic mechanisms responsible for observed results.
The potential effect of RIPC on AF inducibility and/or prothrombotic activity might be implemented as additional treatment component to reduce AF burden and minimize thromboembolic risk.
Interim Analysis will be done after 73 patients.

primary_outcome.measure: inducibility of Atrial Fibrillation by high-rate pacing of 20 s
primary_outcome.time_frame: during the Atrial Fibrillation Ablation procedure

primary_outcome.measure: sustainability of Atrial Fibrillation measured in seconds
primary_outcome.time_frame: during the Atrial Fibrillation Ablation procedure

arm_group.description: After randomization patients will undergo 3 sessions of RIPC (Remote ischemic preconditioning) intervention: I) on preoperative day, II) 1 h before and III) directly before the blood sample collection and invasive measurement of electrophysiological parameters.

After randomization patients will undergo 3 sessions of sham-intervention: I) on preoperative day, II) 1 h before and III) directly before the blood sample collection and invasive measurement of electrophysiological parameters.

intervention.description: RIPC will be induced by the application of 3 short episodes (5 minutes) of forearm ischemia by cuff sphygmomanometer inflation separated by 5 minutes of reperfusion.
In the control group the cuff will be inflated for 3 times at 10 mm Hg for 5 minutes with 5-minute intervals

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- planned invasive Atrial Fibrillation ablation
Exclusion Criteria:
- AF in ECG at Admission
- history of AF ablation
- age <18
- pregnancy
- neoplastic disorders
- acute or systemic inflammation, autoimmune diseases
- documented atrial flutter
